Several study suggest vitamin D supplementation early childhood decrease risk develop type 1 diabetes , therefore vitamin D deficiency might play role disease pathogenesis . We investigate whether supplementation active form vitamin D ( calcitriol ) subject recent-onset type 1 diabetes protect residual beta cell function evaluate C peptide improve glycaemic control evaluate HbA1c insulin requirement . Thirty-four subject ( age range 11-35 year , median 18 year ) recent-onset type 1 diabetes ( < 12 week duration ) high basal C-peptide > 0.25 nmol/l randomize double-blind trial calcitriol ( active form vitamin D , 1.25-dihydroxyvitamin D3 [ 1,25- ( OH ) 2D3 ] ) dose 0.25 ug/day placebo , follow 2 year .
